newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Aboriginal culture may be oldest living religion.
newsitem.headline: Aboriginal culture may be oldest living religion.

text.p: Australia's aboriginal culture may be the world's oldest living religion according to a study of "Rainbow Serpent" rock art in northern Australia, say Australian and British anthropologists.

The "Rainbow Serpent" is one of the sacred symbols of creation for Aborigines and a study of 107 rock paintings has found the spiritual tradition dates back 6,000 years, according to a report in The Sydney Morning Herald newspaper on Saturday.
"We have a major creation being regarded as extremely important for four to six millenia," said Australian Museum anthropologist Paul Tacon.

"In that sense the major component of this spiritual belief system is much older than the major components of religions and spiritual belief systems found elsewhere in the world," Tacon said in the newspaper.
Hinduism emerged about 3,500 years ago in India and Judaism in the Middle East nearly 4,000 years ago, he said.

The team says that while rock art in Europe dates as far back as 20,000 years, it died out about 9,000 years ago, unlike the aboriginal "Rainbow Serpent" which has been continuously painted from 6,000 years to today.
Aborigines believe that in the "Dreamtime", the begining of time, when the earth was barren and featureless, the "Rainbow Serpent" ploughed through the earth creating rivers and bays.
Tacon and fellow anthropologists from Australia and Britian's Cambridge University have published their study in the latest edition of the journal, Archaeoloy in Oceania, the newspaper said.
The team based its study on 137 characteristics of 107 "Rainbow Serpent" rock paintings in Arnhem Land in the Northern Territory and interviews with aboriginal leaders.
Aborigines are believed to have arrived in Australia 40,000 years ago from Southeast Asia. There are now about 300,000 Aborigines in Australia.
